thread.title: Prep basketball players ranked at talent showcase
thread.title_full: Prep basketball players ranked at talent showcase

title: Prep basketball players ranked at talent showcase
text:
Prep basketball players ranked at talent showcase Jim Krajewski , jkrajewski@rgj.com 12:08 p.m. PDT October 16, 2015 Buy Photo Spanish Springs' Marcus Loadholt (33) is rated the top high school player in Northern Nevada. (Photo: Andy Barron, Andy Barron/RGJ) Buy Photo 100 CONNECT 18 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
High school basketball season is still six weeks away, but some former Nevada Wolf Pack players got a jump on things when they hosted a basketball camp last Saturday at Reno High and the Pennington Boys & Girls Club. 
Garry Hill-Thomas, Kevinn Pinkney and former Reed coach Dustin Hall put on the event, and evaluated the 90 boys basketball players who showed up. 
Hill-Thomas said the goal is to get the Northern Nevada players some national exposure. He said only Las Vegas-area players are on the ESPN page that lists each state’s top players. 
Former Nevada coach Len Stevens also helped scout the players at the event called ‘Talent Out West Showcase’ and Spanish Springs junior Marcus Loadholt was ranked No. 1. 
On the overall list, after Loadholt, were Jayden DeJoseph, junior, Carson; Brevon Engelson, senior, Battle Mountain; Octavian Corley, senior, McQueen and Dillon Voyles, junior, Galena. 
The attendees were also ranked by class. 
Hill-Thomas, who said almost every school in the North was represented, plans to hold another camp in the spring, for both boys and girls. 
High school basketball gets underway Dec. 1 
The Top 10 Overall List of players ranked were (regardless of grade): 1. Marcus Loadholt (Spanish Springs, 11th grade)2. Jayden DeJoseph (Carson HS, 11th grade)3. Brevon Engelson (Battle Mountain HS, 12th grade)4. Octavian Corley (McQueen HS, 12th grade)5. Dillon Voyles (Galena HS, 11th grade)6. Michael Heydon (Reno HS, 12th grade)7. Michael Johnson (Douglas HS, 12th grade)8. Tez Allen (Carson HS, 11th grade)9. Zach Burns (Fernley HS, 10th grade)10. Matthew Musselman (Monte Vista HS, CA, 9th grade)
